title: NARA Reparative Description documents

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

By way of background: 

At some point near the end of 2024, NARA published a report titled "2024 Update for Reparative Description" at <https://www.archives.gov/research/reparative-description/update-2024>.  (This page has since been removed.) The update states NARA "moved reparative description work from a temporary working group to incorporating reparative description into the regular description processes of the agency". The page makes reference to various processes and training materials, for which it is reasonable to assume there will be records. Specifically, NARA wrote:

1. "We are incorporating reparative description training into the regular agency-wide training program for the staff who work on description."
2. "We developed and implemented processes for terms to be identified and recommendations for updating to be submitted by staff or the public for consideration."
3. "We developed the process for our standards board to review submissions and provide final recommendations for the Archivist."

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of any "reparative description training" materials referenced at the above web page. If they are embedded within a larger web page, document, PDF, slide deck, or video, the entire training document is requested. This request for the version of the materials which is being referenced at the time of the publication of the undated Update above. If it cannot be determined anymore what the publication date is, December 31, 2024.

2. A copy of the agency policy, guidelines, memo, or other documents which were referred to when NARA described that it had developed "processes for terms to be identified and recommendations for updating".

3.  A copy of the agency policy, guidelines, memo, or other documents which were referred to when NARA described that it had developed "the process for our standards board to review submissions and provide final recommendations"

4. Copies of any such recommendations made to the Archivist by the NARA Lifecycle Data Standards Board under the above cited process, both approved and rejected (if any). Or if they were tracked in a spreadsheet or similar single document with information about the recommendations and the Archivist's responses, this is preferable to conducting a search of emails.

5. As pertains to the process(es) outlined in request #2 & #3 above, I also request a copy of the CURRENT authorized version of the operative agency policy, if it has changed since it was described in the statement in the 2024 Update. Or, if it was rescinded, any memo or record indicating such.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of any charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Darren Barton-McDougall

title: Sgt. Derrick Williamson Incident Report (City of Tarrant)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any incident report filed by (or relating to) Derrick Williamson and/or Chuck Winborn, as reported by AL.com: https://www.al.com/news/birmingham/2025/04/theyre-trying-to-shut-him-up-activist-arrested-after-social-media-posts.html. The incident report would likely have been made after January 1, 2025.

2. Any records referenced in (or associated with) the incident report, such as photographs, screenshots, emails, or other records.

3. A copy of the video of Derrick Williamson referenced in the AL.com article, which video allegedly shows Williamson entering the office of Chief Wendell Major.

4. A copy of the Facebook post by Chuck Winborn referenced in the AL.com article.

5. Any communications sent to or by Derrick Williamson referencing Winborn or any of the following terms on or after January 1, 2025: Chuck, Winborn, Facebook, post.

6. Any communications between Derrick Williamson and Wayman Newton on or after January 1, 2025.

7. Any communications sent to or by Wayman Newton referencing Winborn or any of the following terms on or after January 1, 2025: Chuck, Winborn, Facebook, post.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Adam Steinbaugh.

title: Lamar Probate Court's Failure to Accommodate

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the 'Uniform Probate Court Rules' (including Rule 1. Preliminary Provisions; Rule 4. Court Records), I hereby request the following records:

1) Who is the ADA Coordinator for the Probate Court of Lamar County?
2) What is the PROCESS FOR REQUESTING disability accommodations through the Probate Court of Lamar County? 
3) Provide a WRITTEN POLICY of the Probate Court of Lamar County's ADA/Section 504 policy on the accommodation process (as required by the 'Uniform Probate Court Rules' Rule 4. Court Records). 
4) What is the POLICY FOR FILING FORMAL COMPLAINTS when the Probate Court of Lamar County ignores a disabled person's request for accommodations? 

Based on information received from SEVERAL INDIVIDUALS, the Probate Court of Lamar County has failed to adequately respond to requests for disability accommodations under the Americans with Disabilities Act and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act. The ADA protects ALL participants, including parties, witnesses, jurors, observers, attendees at events, and attorneys (collectively referred to as "Parties" going forward) (See  42 U.S.C. § 12101; See Prakel v. Indiana, App. F, p. 9.; See Mosier v. Kentucky, App. F, p. 10). 

Individuals "with disabilities SHALL NOT, by reason of their disability, be discriminated against, or be excluded from participation in or denied the benefits of services and programs conducted by the courts" (See 'A Meaningful Opportunity to Participate: A Handbook for Georgia Court Officials on Courtroom Accessibility for Individuals with Disabilities'). Since early 2023, it appears multiple requests for disability accommodations have been submitted to the Probate Court of Lamar County without any further directions, guidance, or equal access. Consequently, SEVERAL INDIVIDUALS have reported being unable to gain equal access to the Probate Court of Lamar County. Several Parties requiring equal access, effective communication, and accommodations have been ignored often causing harm to those individuals. 

THIS REQUIREMENT APPLIES TO ALL COMMUNICATION-RELATED COURT ACTIVITIES AND INFORMATION INCLUDING: HEARINGS, JURY DELIBERATIONS, WEBSITES, ELECTRONIC COMMUNICATIONS SUCH AS FORMS AND DOCUMENTS, ANNOUNCEMENTS, COURT DECISIONS AND ORDERS, SIGNAGE, AND OTHERS (A Meaningful Opportunity to Participate, p. 19). For example, communicating with Parties via email who cannot use a telephone, clerk or other staff members handwriting information in forms for individuals who have physical impairments, and more. 

For example:

*The Probate Court of Lamar County fails to scan documents into the online system available to all probate courts in Georgia (https://georgiaprobaterecords.com). Therefore, Parties do not have access to Lamar County Probate records. 
     >When the Probate Court of Lamar County provides paper records to Parties, they cannot be scanned or recognized by screen reader technology, as required by Title III of the ADA, and several other laws. 

*The ADA Title II regulations mandate that all US state and local government websites and mobile applications meet the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 at Level A and AA.
     >The Probate Court of Lamar County does NOT comply with the WCAG guidelines, as required by Title II of the ADA /Section 504 (https://www.lamarcountyga.com/departments/probate-court).
     >This prevents Parties from being able to contact the Probate Court of Lamar County. 

This is another GOOD FAITH attempt to exhaust as many potential administrative remedies to gain equal access, effective communication, and accommodations for multiple Parties that have been excluded from the Probate Court of Lamar County over the last two years on the basis of disability. 

The Supreme Court decided in Tennessee v. Lane in 2004 (above, footnote 1) that states are subject to lawsuits filed in federal court under Title II for money damages, injunctive relief, and declaratory relief; Congress had appropriately abrogated sovereign immunity when it enacted the ADA, specifically as to “judicial services.” See case description, App. F, p. 1. 

TO CONCLUDE AND REITERATE: 

1) Who is the ADA Coordinator for the Probate Court of Lamar County?
2) What is the process for requesting disability accommodations through the Probate Court of Lamar County? 
3) Provide a written policy of the Probate Court of Lamar County's ADA/Section 504 policy on the accommodation process (as required by the 'Uniform Probate Court Rules' Rule 4. Court Records). 

NOTE: There should be no fees associated with fulfilling this request, as Public Entities are not allowed to place surcharges on attempts to request legal disability accommodations. 

In the event that there are fees, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling this request to document another example of surcharges being placed on disabled Parties attempting to have equal access to the Probate Court of Lamar County. This request should preferably be fulfilled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. A response from someone within three days is expected. 

Sincerely, 

Disabled Individuals attempting to gain basic access to Lamar County Courts.

communications.subject: #25-0128: California Public Records Act Request: Gift/Grant Agreements with the Koret Foundation as related to UC Davis
communications.communication:
Dear Ed Burton:

This is to acknowledge your California Public Records Act (CPRA) request. Appropriate UC Office of the President offices are being notified of your request. Records identified as responsive to your request will be reviewed, and made available for your access, in accordance with relevant law and University policy. The estimated date of production for all new requests is eight weeks, though we are often able to provide records more quickly.

Please note that there is no central repository for all University records. The identification and collection of potentially responsive records is only the first step in the CPRA response process. The collected records must be reviewed by this office to ensure that they are in fact responsive to your request and to assess whether any legal privileges or exemptions from disclosure are applicable and whether redactions may be required to protect individuals’ rights to privacy. Please also bear in mind that we are concurrently fulfilling numerous other requests, many of which were received before yours and that we generally process requests in the order in which they are received.

Although the requested records have not yet been fully gathered and reviewed, it is possible that the requested material may contain information exempt from disclosure pursuant to the CPRA. However, this is not a determination that the requested records are necessarily exempt from disclosure. This office will provide you with a status update after the requested records have been thoroughly reviewed.

Inquiries about this CPRA request should refer to CPRA #25-0128.

Sincerely,
UCOP Public Records
UC, Office of the President
1111 Franklin St.
Oakland, CA 94607
pra@ucop.edu<mailto:pra@ucop.edu>

title: Bryan Parr Arrest

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Bryan Parr Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am submitting this letter in order to request all documents, public information and public records related to the arrest of Bryan Parr, described below.  Please be advised that this request is hereby submitted pursuant to:

•	Texas Occupations Code 1701.661
•	The Texas Open Records Act; 
•	Texas Government Code Chapter 552; and
•	The Federal Freedom of Information Act.  

I would like to request that all such public information and records be produced as soon as possible.  Please be advised that your agency will be paid the requisite fees, in accordance with the Open Records Act, with respect to your compliance with this request for the production of public records and documents.

Our office represents Bryan Christopher Parr in regard to a wrongful arrest that took place on July 19, 2024 in the 200 Block of Hallsburg Road in McLennan County involving Deputy Derrick L. Shaw.  

The public information and documents which I am requesting at this time (including information that is collected, assembled, or maintained under a law or ordinance or in connection with the transaction of official business by or for a government body, which included the media on which the public information is recorded, paper, film, magnetic, optical, and/or solid state device that can store an electronic signal; tape; computer disk; etc.) are as follows:
•	Any reports, including supplemental reports, regarding the arrest and detention of Bryan Parr on July 19, 2024 by Deputy Derrick Shaw.

•	Any video or photographs taken at the scene of the arrest, or in the officer’s cruiser, 

•	Any witness statements, handwritten notes, or supplemental report information, 

•	An audio copy of the 911 calls from witnesses, along with any witness names, addresses, and phone numbers that may be in possession of the communications center, along with any police reports that correspond to this particular incident. 

•	Copies of all sketches, diagrams, witness statements and/or names and phone numbers of witnesses at the scene who did not give statements that may be in the possession of your department.

•	A full and complete copy of Deputy Derrick L. Shaw’s personnel file, to include any records of disciplinary action taken against Deputy Shaw since his employment began with the McLennan County Sherriff’s Office.

•	Any documents, handwritten notes, emails, text messages or written communication regarding Deputy Derrick Shaw’s violation of McLennan County Sheriff’s Office policies since his employment began with the McLennan County Sheriff’s Office.

•	A full and complete copy of any results, reports, documents, handwritten notes, emails, text messages or written communication associated with any internal investigation regarding the arrest and detention of Bryan Parr on July 19, 2024 by Deputy Derrick Shaw

•	A full and complete copy of every incident report authored by or at the direction of Deputy Derrick Shaw since his employment began with the McLennan County Sheriff’s Office.

•	A full and complete copy of any report generated by a polygrapher as a result of a polygraph examination conducted on Deputy Derrick Shaw in relation to the arrest and detention of Bryan Parr on July 19, 2024 by Deputy Derrick Shaw.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Vic Feazell

title: Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 FOIA Logs (Department of Justice, Office of the Attorney General)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 FOIA Logs (Department of Justice, Office of the Attorney General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the log of all Freedom of Information Act request made between 2019 and 2025 that includes the term "Title IX" within reference to the Education Amendments of 1972, specifically as they refer to sexual misconduct policy. I ask that all fields — including the subject of the request, the nature and description of the request, the requester, the status of the request, the dates on which it was requested and the date of its most recent status, the tracking number assigned to the request, and the final disposition of the request — be included.

I require this data for academic research purposes, in association with the University of Maryland - College Park. The study aims to understand the recent history of the development of Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, from 2010 to now.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sarah Silberman

communications.subject: Lenzer 2025-3548 Communications FOIA directives - Clarification Needed
communications.communication:
Good morning,

We have received your FOIA request seeking:

...links to any and all directives (or full copies of the directives if not available via a link) regarding cuts to FDA media relations staff and to staff with the FDA FOIA office. Similarly, I am requesting copies of emails or other forms of communication sent to FDA staff with the media relations and FOIA offices that were issued this year.

However, you did not specify a time frame for your request, e.g. a start date for the search.  It is also unclear if you are asking for:


  1.  Copies of directives or emails sent to all FDA employees that related to media relations and/or FOIA staff being impacted by recent Reduction in Force (RIF) actions, e.g. how "media relations" or FOIA activities would be managed post-RIF?

  1.  Memos or emails identifying "media relations" and/or FOIA staff that would be subject to RIF, e.g. a list of RIFed employees?

  1.  Emails sent to "media relations" and/or FOIA staff who were subject to the RIF?

If none of the above items describes what you are seeking, please clarify what types of records you are seeking.  Also, feel free to call me to discuss your request.  If we do not hear back from you by May 14, 2025, we will presume you are no longer interested in this matter and will close the file on this request.

Sincerely,

C.

​________________________
Charis Wilson, PhD, CRM
Denials & Appeals Officer

Office of Management and Enterprise Services
Office of the Commissioner
U.S. Food and Drug Administration
240-402-9116

title: Jefferson Davis Parish Jury List Request

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Jefferson Davis Parish Jury List Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act I hereby request the following records:
The following materials regarding the compilation and composition of the state’s master jury list:

All current policies and procedures regarding how the current master jury list was compiled and how often master jury lists are reviewed and updated. Please name all source lists (driver’s license records, voter registration lists, etc) that were utilized in creating the current master jury list.

All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding the composition of the current master jury list. Please include the total number of individuals on the current master jury list and all relevant demographic data, including but not limited to the race, age and gender of individuals that comprise the current master jury list.

In the event that there are any fees for obtaining or copying these records, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. Should the fees exceed $100, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees as I am requesting the information on behalf of a 501(c)(3) nonprofit and the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of how master jury lists are created. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.
If possible, please provide the requested documents electronically. However, if this is not feasible, please inform me of the available methods for obtaining these records. Further, if you expect a significant delay in responding to this request, please contact me with information concerning when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption that justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within the timeframe required by the statute.

communications.subject: Public Record Request
communications.communication: In response to your Public Records Request received on Wednesday, April 16, 2025, in order to respond to your request, Louisiana law requires a signed written request along with the name and address of the requestor as well as proof that the requestor is over the age of majority.  Please also be aware that the Public Records law allows Clerks of Court offices to charge a fee for the copies of any documents requested.  There will be a charge for copies of any documents requested.  In order to avoid these costs you may inspect any public records at our office between the hours of 8:30 a.m and 4:30 p.m. Monday through Friday  and except on legal holidays.  There will still be a cost for copies you request.

title: Hedge Fund Request

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Hedge Fund Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

You kindly sent us copies of your records that show information as listed below dated to September 30 2024. Please will it be possible to have an update on any records that would show some or all of the following information:
1. A list of ALL hedge funds and fund of hedge funds in which Richmond Retirement System is an investor; and
2. For each hedge fund and fund of hedge funds, may I please have a copy of any records that would show some or all of the following information:
a. the month by month market value of Richmond Retirement System's holding in each fund from October 1 2024 to December 31 2024
b. the month by month amount invested by Richmond Retirement System in each fund from October 1 2024 to December 31 2024
c. the month by month net returns (net of fees) earned by Richmond Retirement System on its investment in each fund from October 1 2024 to December 31 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Haley Parker.
